about-me: As a highly experienced Computer Science Engineer with over 15 years in the software development industry, I have successfully completed more than 20 projects for various organizations. My expertise lies in the business sector, particularly in ERP systems, as well as in the technology industry for electronic payment transactions and value-added services at points of sale. Throughout my career, I have held diverse roles such as Analyst Programmer, Team Leader, Project Manager, and Solutions Architect, allowing me to gain extensive experience in all phases of software development and effectively lead teams. Additionally, I have had the privilege of sharing my knowledge and expertise as a thesis tutor and opponent for graduate students, contributing to the academic growth of emerging professionals. With a strong understanding of both agile and traditional heavyweight methodologies, I have successfully managed projects using Agile methodologies such as Scrum and Kanban, prioritizing iterative development, collaboration, and adaptability. Moreover, I have also worked with traditional project management methodologies, ensuring thorough project planning, risk assessment, and meticulous documentation. Having worked in diverse international settings, I possess excellent adaptability skills and a global perspective, enabling me to seamlessly navigate cross-border projects. Furthermore, my comprehensive understanding of all business areas associated with software development solutions, from initial client interactions to post-implementation support, allows me to assess project requirements holistically and provide tailored solutions that align with organizational goals. I am eager to join your team and contribute my skills and experience to drive success.
